title: Asos warms up for a Black Friday sales blitz after failing to make the most of it last year
text:
Bargain hunt: Asos is filling its warehouses as its management strives to avoid the mistakes made last year

Online fashion giant Asos has primed its warehouses for a Black Friday sale blitz that could be a major blow to high street retailers.

The company is understood to have built up fashion stocks by a third compared with the same time last year, when it failed to capitalise on the event.

Stockbroker Peel Hunt said Asos is preparing to ‘go hard’ at the event and planning ‘a big peak season’.

News of the Asos plan will not be welcomed by high street shops which have desperately tried to row back from Black Friday discounting.

The end of November is regarded by high street fashion shop operators as the worst time to cut prices heavily as shoppers go hunting for Christmas party outfits.

The threat of a General Election in the middle of peak trading in mid-December has also set high street firms on alert.

Peel Hunt analyst John Stevenson said: ‘While a number of high street and multi-channel retailers try to ignore Black Friday, the reality is that it is a huge event for consumers now and for online retailers.

‘It is becoming one of the single biggest events for new customer recruitment.’
